intro: Laugeria resinosa, commonly known as the resinous laugeria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody structure and produces a distinctive, aromatic resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Its resinous sap is a key feature, contributing to its ecological and medicinal significance. Laugeria resinosa thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
